root: ^Pardon me, do you know how much longer until we reach Stonefolk?
^Um, I think it’ll still be another three or four hours.
^Gosh, that seems so long, thank you.
^Are you worried about missing your connection or?
^Oh, no luckily not! My partner is going to be picking me up for the train so I just wanted to make sure I told them the right time to pick me up.
^I’m sure they’ll have no problem waiting for you even if the train is a little bit late.
^I know they won’t, but they’ve been through enough waiting already. I’d hate to make them wait even an hour longer.
^Yes. Well. I’m actually moving to the city to be with them.
^We’ve been long distance for 4 years now and we’ve finally decided to make the big step.
^I can’t believe it but I’ve managed to fit everything important into this one suitcase!
^That must be so exciting! Even a little bit scary.
^It’s definitely scary, I like the town I lived in and I liked my life there but I think I’m going to like my life with them in Stonefolk more.
^You’ll get to have so many new experiences!
^You can always go back and visit.

new_life: ^That’s what I’m excited about the most!
^I’m really looking forward to decorating our new apartment.
^We just found this perfect little place in my favourite neighbourhood in the city.
^It has a balcony and I’ll admit it’s much bigger than my old apartment.
^Ooh I would love to have a bunch of plants!
^I’ve just been daydreaming about how I’ll be able to have room for me to work on my art.
^And my partner will still have room for all their favourite dusty old books too!
^A good library is an important part of a home.
old_life: ^I know, even though it will be hard to visit at times.
^I’ll really miss my old town and I know it’ll always be there for me if I need it.
^But I feel so sure about this move and about being with my partner that I don’t even feel that sad about it!
^You’ve got so many new things to look forward to why even worry about being sad about what you leave behind?
^Gosh, that sounds a bit harsh when you say it like that but it’s true! I’m really moving forward with my life and it’s all only looking up!
^Which I’m sure you’ll be doing plenty of in the city, bigger buildings and all.
^Aha! Yes, luckily my new place isn’t in some dizzyingly tall tower, I can actually take the stairs.
^There is so much new stuff for you to look forward to in the city, I can’t help but feel excited for you too!
^Thank you, that’s honestly so nice to hear.
cat_name_talk: ^The thing I am most excited about, to tell the truth, well aside from getting to live with my partner is…
^We’re thinking of getting a cat together!
^I haven’t had a cat since I was a child since my last sublet wouldn’t allow any pets and my partner has never had a pet before.
^Wow, that’s so exciting! For both of you!
^Constantly. I have one that I really like and my partner has their top choice but we haven’t been able to make a decision yet.
^What names are you trying to pick between?
^Those are truly some interesting names for cats.
^Hey, which one do you like best?
^I kind of like Pants, it’s cute
^Steven, definitely Steven. A strong name for a cat
pants_name: ^It’s such a cute name, isn’t it? I’m just imagining them now, with their little name tag that says Pants.
^She drifts off into thought, looking out the train windows. Almost unaware that you are still there.
steven_name: ^It’s such a curious name, isn’t it? I’m just imagining them now, with their little name tag that says Steven.
^She drifts off into thought, looking out the train windows. Almost unaware that you are still there.
